verses.verse: Righteous <S%H6662><s%> are you, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> I plead <S%H7378><s%> with you: yet <S%H389><s%> let me talk <S%H1696><s%> with you of your judgments: <S%H4941><s%> Why <S%H4069><s%> does the way <S%H1870><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> prosper? <S%H6743><s%> why are all <S%H3605><s%> they happy <S%H7951><s%> that deal very <S%H899><s%> treacherously? <S%H898><s%>

You have planted <S%H5193><s%> them, yes, <S%H1571><s%> they have taken root: <S%H8327><s%> they grow, <S%H3212><s%> yes, <S%H1571><s%> they bring <S%H6213><s%> forth <S%H6213><s%> fruit: <S%H6529><s%> you are near <S%H7138><s%> in their mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and far <S%H7350><s%> from their reins. <S%H3629><s%>

But you, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> me: you have seen <S%H7200><s%> me, and tried <S%H974><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> toward <S%H854><s%> you: pull <S%H5423><s%> them out like sheep <S%H6629><s%> for the slaughter, <S%H2873><s%> and prepare <S%H6942><s%> them for the day <S%H3117><s%> of slaughter. <S%H2028><s%>

How <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> shall the land <S%H776><s%> mourn, <S%H56><s%> and the herbs <S%H6212><s%> of every <S%H3605><s%> field <S%H7704><s%> wither, <S%H3001><s%> for the wickedness <S%H7451><s%> of them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein? the beasts <S%H929><s%> are consumed, <S%H5595><s%> and the birds; <S%H5775><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> they said, <S%H559><s%> He shall not see <S%H7200><s%> our last <S%H319><s%> end.

If <S%H3588><s%> you have run <S%H7323><s%> with the footmen, <S%H7273><s%> and they have wearied <S%H3811><s%> you, then how <S%H349><s%> can you contend <S%H8474><s%> with horses? <S%H5483><s%> and if in the land <S%H776><s%> of peace, <S%H7965><s%> wherein you trusted, <S%H982><s%> they wearied you, then how <S%H349><s%> will you do <S%H6213><s%> in the swelling <S%H1347><s%> of Jordan? <S%H3383><s%>

For even <S%H1571><s%> your brothers, <S%H251><s%> and the house <S%H1004><s%> of your father, <S%H1><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> they have dealt treacherously <S%H898><s%> with you; yes, <S%H1571><s%> they have called <S%H7121><s%> a multitude <S%H4392><s%> after <S%H310><s%> you: believe <S%H539><s%> them not, though <S%H3588><s%> they speak <S%H1696><s%> fair <S%H2896><s%> words to you.

I have forsaken <S%H5800><s%> my house, <S%H1004><s%> I have left <S%H5203><s%> my heritage; <S%H5159><s%> I have given <S%H5414><s%> the dearly beloved <S%H3033><s%> of my soul <S%H5315><s%> into the hand <S%H3709><s%> of her enemies. <S%H341><s%>

My heritage <S%H5159><s%> is to me as a lion <S%H738><s%> in the forest; <S%H3293><s%> it cries <S%H5414><s%> <S%H6963><s%> out against <S%H5921><s%> me: therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> have I hated <S%H8130><s%> it.

My heritage <S%H5159><s%> is to me as a speckled <S%H6641><s%> bird, <S%H5861><s%> the birds <S%H5861><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about are against <S%H5921><s%> her; come <S%H3212><s%> you, assemble <S%H622><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the beasts <S%H2416><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> come <S%H857><s%> to devour. <S%H402><s%>

Many <S%H7227><s%> pastors <S%H7462><s%> have destroyed <S%H7843><s%> my vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> they have trodden <S%H947><s%> my portion <S%H2513><s%> under foot, <S%H947><s%> they have made <S%H5414><s%> my pleasant <S%H2532><s%> portion <S%H2513><s%> a desolate <S%H8077><s%> wilderness. <S%H4057><s%>

They have made <S%H7760><s%> it desolate, <S%H8074><s%> and being desolate <S%H8077><s%> it mourns <S%H56><s%> to me; the whole <S%H3605><s%> land <S%H776><s%> is made desolate, <S%H8074><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> no <S%H369><s%> man <S%H376><s%> lays <S%H7760><s%> it to heart. <S%H3820><s%>

The spoilers <S%H7703><s%> are come <S%H935><s%> on all <S%H3605><s%> high <S%H8205><s%> places through the wilderness: <S%H4057><s%> for the sword <S%H2719><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> from the one end <S%H7097><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> even to the other end <S%H7097><s%> of the land: <S%H776><s%> no <S%H369><s%> flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall have peace. <S%H7965><s%>

They have sown <S%H2232><s%> wheat, <S%H2406><s%> but shall reap <S%H7114><s%> thorns: <S%H6975><s%> they have put themselves to pain, <S%H2470><s%> but shall not profit: <S%H3276><s%> and they shall be ashamed <S%H954><s%> of your revenues <S%H8393><s%> because of the fierce <S%H2740><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my evil <S%H7451><s%> neighbors, <S%H7934><s%> that touch <S%H5060><s%> the inheritance <S%H5159><s%> which <S%H834><s%> I have caused my people <S%H5971><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> to inherit; <S%H5157><s%> Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I will pluck <S%H5428><s%> them out of their land, <S%H127><s%> and pluck <S%H5428><s%> out the house <S%H1004><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> from among <S%H8432><s%> them.

And it shall come <S%H1961><s%> to pass, after <S%H310><s%> that I have plucked <S%H5428><s%> them out I will return, <S%H7725><s%> and have compassion <S%H7355><s%> on them, and will bring <S%H7725><s%> them again, <S%H7725><s%> every man <S%H376><s%> to his heritage, <S%H5159><s%> and every man <S%H376><s%> to his land. <S%H776><s%>

And it shall come <S%H1961><s%> to pass, if <S%H518><s%> they will diligently learn <S%H3925><s%> the ways <S%H1870><s%> of my people, <S%H5971><s%> to swear <S%H7650><s%> by my name, <S%H8034><s%> The LORD <S%H3068><s%> lives; <S%H2416><s%> as they taught <S%H3925><s%> my people <S%H5971><s%> to swear <S%H7650><s%> by Baal; <S%H1168><s%> then shall they be built <S%H1129><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of my people. <S%H5971><s%>
But if <S%H518><s%> they will not obey, <S%H8085><s%> I will utterly pluck <S%H5428><s%> up and destroy <S%H6><s%> that nation, <S%H1471><s%> said <S%H5002><s%> the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
